text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.4.16, AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Inventory Control.

Minor editorial changes have been made throughout this IRM. Website addresses and IRM references were reviewed and updated as necessary. Also, throughout this IRM references to Coordinator” have been changed to include “AIMS/ERCS Analyst or AIMS Coordinators.”
IRM has been revised throughout to provide clarifications and more in-depth discussions in areas. Significant changes to this IRM are reflected in the table below:
Updated to revise the description of Form
, AIMS Inventory Validation Discrepancy List #

- Case Files in Your Inventory - Not on Your AIMS and/or ERCS IVL. Updated to include re- quirement to list date of action in “Comments” section of IVL for items (c) and (d). Added re- quirement to list whether return was physically located in “Comments” section of IVL - item (e).

SECTION DESCRIPTION Added 15 day time frame for the AIMS/ERCS Analyst or AIMS Coordinator to review and reconcile the validated IVL packages. Also added 15 day time frame for the AIMS/ERCS IRM 4.4.16.6 manager to prepare the validation reports. Revised to add requirement to send copy of LB&I groups’ Validation Report to the LB&I IRM 4.4.16.6 (1) Headquarters Analyst. Revised to exclude CCP and TS from the re- quirement to forward results of validation to IRM 4.4.16.6 (3) Area PSP offices. Updated to clarify that various programs are used in conjunction with AIMS to validate and IRM 4.4.16.7 (1) analyze inventory. Updated to include Issue Management System IRM 4.4.16.7 (5) (IMS) used by LB&I. Updated to include Issue Based Management Information System (IBMIS) as system used by IRM 4.4.16.7 (6) LB&I.
DESCRIPTION
This material supersedes IRM 4.4.16, dated August 1, 2003.
Large Business and International (LB&I), Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE) and Wage and (W&I)

) The procedures shown in this IRM are for field groups, Planning and Special Programs (PSP) and Centralized Case Processing (CCP). (
) This chapter covers inventory control: a. Examination requests b. Inventory validations c. Other inventory monitoring and analysis tools (

-B, Examination Request Non-ERCS Users, and Form

Note: It is not necessary to control a BRTVU/RTVUE print or other electronic print on AIMS or ERCS unless it has been determined that an examination will take place. (

) When an automated control system (such as ERCS) is used to maintain inventory control, locally established procedures should be followed to determine whether a pending requisition suspense file is required. Per IRM

) the control cards will be destroyed: a. For field examination cases: three years after the case has closed for examination cases, or b. For office examination cases: after the validation of inventory from AIMS Validation List or one year after the case closes, whichever is sooner. (

-B and Form are frequently available through local AIMS/ERCS Analysts or AIMS tors. (

) An inventory validation means each validating organization performs a review of each case held in its possession (or shown on its inventory lists) the purpose of determining the physical presence of the returns and the accuracy of certain data elements with respect to the returns. The purpose this review is to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the AIMS and ERCS databases. Note: Inventory established using Compliance Data Environment (CDE) is not exempt from the IVL. Form 5345-B, Examination Request Non-ERCS Users, and Form 5345-D, Ex- amination Request ERCS (Examination Returns Control System) Users, are the most commonly used forms to request examination controls on Audit Infor- mation Management System (AIMS) and Examination Returns Control System
For office examination cases: after the validation of inventory from AIMS Validation List or one year after the case closes, whichever is sooner.
Job aids to assist in the correct preparation of Form 5345-B and Form 5345-D are frequently available through local AIMS/ERCS Analysts or AIMS Coordina-

An inventory validation means each validating organization performs a physical review of each case held in its possession (or shown on its inventory lists) with the purpose of determining the physical presence of the returns and the accuracy of certain data elements with respect to the returns. The purpose of this review is to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the AIMS and ERCS databases.
Note: Inventory established using Compliance Data Environment (CDE) is not exempt from the IVL. There can be inconsistencies between what is in CDE

and what is on AIMS if there were errors when establishing, updating, or livering a return. A return may no longer be in virtual inventory but maybe AIMS/ERCS or vice versa. There may be inconsistencies between the data elements in CDE and those shown on AIMS. (

The statistical sampling IVL feature of the statistical sampling inventory tion listing (SSIVL) program may be used as an alternative to the annual 100 percent inventory validation or the time frame validation. See IRM 4.4.16.5.

whether an error situation exists. Questions should be referred to your local AIMS/ERCS staff or AIMS Coordinator for resolution.

months from original IVL. (
) The first revalidation will be a sampling of returns selected by the Analyst or AIMS Coordinator for the organization. (
) The method of return selection can be done using local procedures. the minimum sample size as discussed in IRM
) must be met. (

) The size of the sample is determined using the sample size table below. The sample of returns selected must represent a mix of the class of returns in the inventory of the validating organization. If this can be accomplished by selecting returns alphabetically from the inventory validation list or by every nth return (for example every

th return), this method of selection is ceptable. If this method of selection does not meet this objective, the AIMS/ ERCS Analyst or AIMS Coordinator will enlarge the number of returns in the sample until each class of returns in an originator’s inventory is represented the sample. If the error rate is within the acceptable number of returns with errors, no further sample or validation is due until the next scheduled period. If it is not, a complete validation is required every
months until the error rate is reduced to the acceptable level.
whether an error situation exists. Questions should be referred to your local AIMS/ERCS staff or AIMS Coordinator for resolution.
Revalidation requirements depend on whether a 100 percent annual validation or the quarterly time frame validation was performed.
The method of return selection can be done using local procedures. the minimum sample size as discussed in IRM 4.4.16.4.3.1 (4) must be met.
If the initial error rate for any validating organization was more than
percent, but all errors have been resolved by the next quarterly IVL, no revalidation is required. For offices that have a greater than
percent error rate for
con- secutive quarters, a
percent validation of the status codes with the high error rate is required during the subsequent quarterly time frame validation until the error rate is reduced to the acceptable level.

If the initial error rate for any validating organization was more than 5 but all errors have been resolved by the next quarterly IVL, no revalidation is required. For offices that have a greater than 5 percent error rate for 2 con- secutive quarters, a 100 percent validation of the status codes with the high error rate is required during the subsequent quarterly time frame validation until the error rate is reduced to the acceptable level.
4.4.16.4.4 (12-20-2011) Quarterly Time Frame Validation
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing
) The AIMS/ERCS Analyst or AIMS Coordinator will distribute the listings to groups/functions within two workdays of generating the sample. the SSIVL (
) The validation will follow the procedures as outlined in IRM

) The manager charged with the sample returns will be responsible for the sample is accurately completed and returning the listing to the Analyst or AIMS Coordinator within four workdays of receipt. (
) The AIMS/ERCS Analyst or AIMS Coordinator will compute an error rate on completed listing. (
) Within
days of receipt of the completed IVL packages, the AIMS/ERCS Analyst or AIMS Coordinator will review and reconcile the packages and the IVL forward to the responsible manager. Within

days of receipt of these packages, the AIMS/ERCS manager or the responsible PSP manager will prepare the validation report and send to the manager of the validating or function. Note: These time frames can be adjusted by the Areas due to workload (such the business organizations performing the IVLs concurrently). (
) For LB&I groups, a copy will be sent to the responsible manager, as well as the LB&I Headquarters Analyst responsible for AIMS. (
) The IVL results should be sent to the Area PSP annually for

percent dation and quarterly for Time Frame validation or the Stat Sampling SSIVL. CCP and TS are excluded from this requirement. CCP IVL results should sent to the CCP Headquarters Analysts. TS IVL results are maintained by AIMS/ERCS Analyst. (

4.4.16.6 (12-20-2011) Reporting the IVL Results
Note: These time frames can be adjusted by the Areas due to workload (such as the business organizations performing the IVLs concurrently).
The report will contain the following information for each organization.
(12-20-2011) 100 Percent Validation and Time Frame Validation Reports
The validation lists and reports of the IVL results (including revalidation documents) should be destroyed after one year plus the current year.
Example: If the group has completed the IVL for fiscal year 2011, they should retain their 2010 and 2011 documents.

, ERCS. AIMS Computer Information System (A-CIS) - The A-CIS database program provides monthly AIMS data on both open and closed cases. Issue Management System (IMS) - The IMS is used by most Large Business and International (LB&I) groups and SB/SE Specialty groups. An IMS and data validation is conducted annually. See the IMS Inventory and Data Validation Home page at http://lmsb.irs.gov/hq/bsp/IMS/ims_ivl_home.asp for more information. Issue Based Management Information System (IBIMS) - The IBIMS is the reporting component that is used to deliver the information collected and managed by IMS. In addition, IBMIS can be used to analyze monthly AIMS data files, as well as, data from the Specialist Referral System (SRS). See the IBMIS Home page at http://lmsb.irs.gov/hq/bsp/IBMIS/IBMIS_User.asp for tional information.
